question.question-text: What are the student and the professor discussing?

answer-list.answer-text: Two characters from a story the student has read

answer-text.exp: The student's plan for a research assignment

answer-list.answer-text: A research study the student has read
Ways for the student to improve

question.explain-text: In the conversation, the student says I have a few questions about my outline for the research project,…and…well…I was hoping you could give me a few pointers. From this, it can be determined that the student and professor are discussing the student's plan for a research assignment. The second answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: What does the professor think about the student's work?
question.scoring-text: This question is worth 2 points (2 points for 3 correct answers, 1 point for 2 correct answers, and 0 points for 1 or 0 correct answers).

answer-list.answer-text: The student does not need an outline.
The student's thesis requires stronger support.
The student should say more about how the characters are the same.
The student needs more information about how the characters differ.

question.explain-text: In the conversation, the professor states that you've got an interesting thesis here, that there just doesn't seem to be quite enough support for this thesis, and that if you're going to make such a strong thesis that…uh…two such opposite characters really have a lot in common…you're definitely going to have to come up with very strong ideas to support this. From this, it can be determined that the professor thinks that the student's thesis is interesting, that the student's thesis requires stronger support, and that the student should say more about how the characters are the same. The second, third, and fourth answers are therefore the best answers to this question.

answer-list.answer-text: One character appears in two different novels.
Two characters that seem alike are not really alike.
One character acts in two extremely different ways.
Two characters who do not seem to resemble each other actually have a lot in common.

question.explain-text: In the conversation, the professor says you're trying to make the point that these two characters are really quite similar in spite of the fact that they seem so different, and the student later says now I need to come up with ideas about how these two characters resemble each other. From this, it can be determined that the student's thesis is that two characters who do not seem to resemble each other actually have a lot in common. The last answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: How does the professor seem to feel about the student's work?

answer-list.answer-text: She is unsure what the student is doing.
She is completely disgusted with the student's work.
She thinks the student's work may have potential.
She is really impressed with the student's work.

question.explain-text: In the conversation, the professor says I like the point you're trying to make, and well, there just doesn't seem to be quite enough support, and I do think your thesis has possibilities, and it can be a really strong thesis, but you need to develop these ideas thoroughly. From this, it can be determined that the professor thinks the student's work may have potential. The third answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: What will the student most likely do next?

answer-text.exp: Work on ways to support his thesis and then share his ideas with the professor

answer-list.answer-text: Stop working on this thesis and start on another
Write down new ideas and submit his written ideas to the professor
Work on his thesis to improve it

question.explain-text: In the conversation, the student says would it be OK if I stopped by in a few days to show you my ideas for how to support this thesis, and the professor responds by saying see you in a few days. From this, it can be determined that the student will most likely work on ways to support his thesis and then share his ideas with the professor next. The first answer is therefore the best answer to this question.
